commit_message:
Prep work before adding each db recipe

Brought in openstack-common as a dep.  Updated the tests to
better match what the recipes are doing (added tests where
missing).  Updated attributes to match the format of our other
cookbooks.  This is mostly some cleanups, to prepare for features.
Since this cookbook is not in use, made a larger commit than
would have if adding functionality to a released cookbook.  Also,
upgraded to new Berkshelf which handles locking to cookbooks properly.

Change-Id: I8e4123d30012a9890ce3029184e1396d2083a6f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-database refs/changes/56/34056/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require_relative "spec_helper" describe "openstack-ops-database::client" do describe "ubuntu" do it "uses proper database client recipe" do chef_run = ::ChefSpec::ChefRunner.new ::UBUNTU_OPTS chef_run.converge "openstack-ops-database::client"
deleted_lines: require_relative 'spec_helper' describe 'openstack-ops-database::client' do describe 'ubuntu' do it "select 'mysql-client' recipe" do chef_run = ::ChefSpec::ChefRunner.new(::UBUNTU_OPTS) do |node| node.set['lsb'] = {'codename' => 'precise'} node.set['openstack']= {'database' => { 'service' => 'mysql' } } end chef_run.converge 'openstack-ops-database::client'

commit_message:
Pass before and after snippets to template diff

The before template should be passed explicitly, rather than relying on
some state stored in the object.

Change-Id: I5b0af8da2e1df3f6ad3291554cbbc243b51e3fe5

Remove deprecated features

When running in httpd, Django complains about deprecations.

Fixes bug 1172222

commit_message:
Changes for HOT hello world template processing

This patch contains the base enabling code required for processing a most
simple HOT template ("hot hello world"), so that the template can be
parsed and a stack with a single instance can be deployed.

Contributes to blueprint hot-hello-world

Change-Id: I4f0a04a06fab2f5472cb4481dcdf10d5239d5def

commit_message:
Make info_cache handle when network_info is None

The info_cache['network_info'] data can be None, so don't string-
convert it to 'None'.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I7a18f9189ab31beca0f8df764531387b4dd41b50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/33873/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import utils from nova.openstack.common import jsonutils 'network_info': utils.str_or_none, if isinstance(db_obj['network_info'], basestring): info_cache.network_info = db_obj['network_info'] else: info_cache.network_info = jsonutils.dumps(db_obj['network_info'])
deleted_lines: 'network_info': str, info_cache.network_info = db_obj['network_info']

subject: Fix and Use rabbitmq-server element in boot-stack
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-06-26 18:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/install.d/01-boot-stack', 'elements/rabbitmq-server/install.d/20-rabbitmq-server', 'elements/boot-stack/element-deps', 'elements/rabbitmq-server/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/50-rabbitmq-passwords', 'elements/boot-stack/first-boot.d/98-boot-stack'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/8fd4ed83283b7d71e17685924e160cf189172c72', 'message': 'Fix and Use rabbitmq-server element in boot-stack

Rabbit MQ is a separate service and has configuration logic, so the
entangled configuration within boot-stack was inappropriate.

* Remove rabitmq-server restart in boot-stack firstboot.
* Move custom upstart script from boot-stack into rabbitmq-server
  element.
* Make rabbitmq-server orc properly handle empty heat_users.json file.

Fix bug 1166838

Change-Id: I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f

Rabbit MQ is a separate service and has configuration logic, so the
entangled configuration within boot-stack was inappropriate.

* Remove rabitmq-server restart in boot-stack firstboot
* Move custom upstart script from boot-stack into rabbitmq-server
  element
* Make rabbitmq-server orc properly handle empty heat_users.json file

commit_message:
Fix and Use rabbitmq-server element in boot-stack

Rabbit MQ is a separate service and has configuration logic, so the
entangled configuration within boot-stack was inappropriate.

* Remove rabitmq-server restart in boot-stack firstboot.
* Move custom upstart script from boot-stack into rabbitmq-server
  element.
* Make rabbitmq-server orc properly handle empty heat_users.json file.

Fix bug 1166838

Change-Id: I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/04/33904/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix instance object's use of a db query method parameter

The limit and marker arguments are kwargs, which need to be
correct to pass some mock tests in the unit tests for api.

Related to unified-object-model

commit_message:
Add Instance.fault

This makes Instance load fault as an optional attribute, if
requested. I didn't implement save for this, as I'm not sure
we will (want to) support setting instance faults via that
interface.

Related to unified-object-model
Fixes bug 1192004

Change-Id: I581e1f49c4c593ece97cf32dc7cea3f7a7cbd953

commit_message:
Add basic InstanceFault model

This adds a basic InstanceFault model, list, and tests.

Related to blueprint unified-objet-model

Change-Id: I9226bc1f6e21d298b6d5d8694d336d38e471846d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/33551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import context from nova import db from nova.objects import instance_fault from nova.tests.objects import test_objects fake_faults = { 'fake-uuid': [ {'id': 1, 'instance_uuid': 'fake-uuid', 'code': 123, 'message': 'msg1', 'details': 'details', 'host': 'host', 'deleted': False, 'created_at': None, 'updated_at': None, 'deleted_at': None}, {'id': 2, 'instance_uuid': 'fake-uuid', 'code': 456, 'message': 'msg2', 'details': 'details', 'host': 'host', 'deleted': False, 'created_at': None, 'updated_at': None, 'deleted_at': None}, ] } class _TestInstanceFault(object): def test_get_latest_for_instance(self): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids') db.instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids(ctxt, ['fake-uuid']).AndReturn( fake_faults) self.mox.ReplayAll() fault = instance_fault.InstanceFault.get_latest_for_instance( ctxt, 'fake-uuid') for key in fake_faults['fake-uuid'][0]: self.assertEqual(fake_faults['fake-uuid'][0][key], fault[key]) def test_get_latest_for_instance_with_none(self): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids') db.instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids(ctxt, ['fake-uuid']).AndReturn( {}) self.mox.ReplayAll() fault = instance_fault.InstanceFault.get_latest_for_instance( ctxt, 'fake-uuid') self.assertEqual(None, fault) def test_get_by_instance(self): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids') db.instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids(ctxt, ['fake-uuid']).AndReturn( fake_faults) self.mox.ReplayAll() faults = instance_fault.InstanceFaultList.get_by_instance_uuids( ctxt, ['fake-uuid']) for index, db_fault in enumerate(fake_faults['fake-uuid']): for key in db_fault: self.assertEqual(fake_faults['fake-uuid'][index][key], faults[index][key]) def test_get_by_instance_with_none(self): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids') db.instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids(ctxt, ['fake-uuid']).AndReturn( {}) self.mox.ReplayAll() faults = instance_fault.InstanceFaultList.get_by_instance_uuids( ctxt, ['fake-uuid']) self.assertEqual(0, len(faults)) class TestInstanceFault(test_objects._LocalTest, _TestInstanceFault): pass class commit_message:
Content-length missing in put_object

Radosgw returns a "411 Length Required" in case the content-length is not
specified. The parameter content_type is not set which leads to the problem
that content_length cannot be determined. Since the content length is already
computed in backup/services/swift it shouldn't be a problem to set this
parameter.

Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/services/swift.py

Change-Id: I4c56823d70fcd1a801a75bfd14f474a2780dc1ac

commit_message:
Deliver HOT hello world template

This patch delivers a most simple HOT template with only a single instance,
no software, and just a few basic parameters and output.
The template can be processed with the code delivered in this patch

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33258/

applied to the heat repository.

Contributes to blueprint hot-hello-world

Change-Id: Ib87a88aa4a71f1c1f147084273610b95bda704c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/61/33261/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is a hello world HOT template just defining a single compute instance heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 description: > Hello world HOT template that just defines a single compute instance. Contains just base features to verify base HOT support. parameters: KeyName: type: string description: Name of an existing key pair to use for the instance InstanceType: type: string description: Instance type for the instance to be created ImageId: type: string description: ID of the image to use for the instance resources: my_instance: # Use an AWS resource type since this exists; so why use other name here? type: AWS::EC2::Instance properties: KeyName: get_param(KeyName) ImageId: get_param(ImageId) InstanceType: get_param(InstanceType) outputs: instance_ip: description: The IP address of the deployed instance value: get_attr(my_instance, PublicIp)

commit_message:
Change ring partition size for SAIO

Making this smaller (10 instead of 18) can make some of the tests run
faster and makes rebuilding of the rings faster.

commit_message:
Revert "Allocate networks in the background"

This reverts commit 3a89638691b1e9eb167886793c7819be4fd8dc4f.

We're seeing a lot of jenkins failures and this patch is a potential
cause.  I'm proposing a revert so we can see if it helps, and merge it
if it seems to be the fix.

Change-Id: Ib66c7cc02c7c1ac012ce3afaf413f8b6961bb785

added_lines: raise """Allocate networks for an instance and return the network info.""" try: # allocate and get network info network_info = self.network_api.allocate_for_instance( context, instance, vpn=is_vpn, requested_networks=requested_networks, macs=macs, conductor_api=self.conductor_api, security_groups=security_groups) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_('Instance failed network setup'), instance=instance) LOG.debug(_('Instance network_info: |%s|'), network_info, instance=instance) return network_info

Return an instance of NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper that can be used to retrieve the allocated networks when the operation has finished. """ # NOTE(comstud): Since we're allocating networks asynchronously, # this task state has little meaning, as we won't be in this # state for very long. def async_alloc(): LOG.debug(_("Allocating IP information in the background."), instance=instance) try: nwinfo = self.network_api.allocate_for_instance( context, instance, vpn=is_vpn, requested_networks=requested_networks, macs=macs, conductor_api=self.conductor_api, security_groups=security_groups) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_('Instance failed network setup'), instance=instance) LOG.debug(_('Instance network_info: |%s|'), nwinfo, instance=instance) return nwinfo return network_model.NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper(async_alloc)

commit_message:
LDAP list group users not fail if user entry deleted

Using the LDAP identity backend,
if a group member entry doesn't exist in the LDAP server anymore
and the group's members are listed using GET /v3/groups/{groupId}/users,
Keystone returns 404 Not Found.

The server should return all the group members that do exist
and ignore the missing members.

Fixes bug 1174585

Change-Id: I97b53e3d5a5810aa0818b785e23a1948499b29e8

commit_message:
Refactor db.security_group_get() instance join behavior

Currently, security_group['instances'] is always joined when we
do a db.security_group_get(). This patch adds the growingly-
conventional columns_to_join argument to the call, allowing
us to selectively choose when we want to make this expensive
join operation.

Related to unified-object-model

Change-Id: I1945365c8cf03c027fd143f677cbd6d63a7f8122
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/00/34000/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def security_group_get(context, security_group_id, columns_to_join=None, session=None): query = _security_group_get_query(context, session=session, project_only=True).\ filter_by(id=security_group_id) if columns_to_join is None: columns_to_join = [] if 'instances' in columns_to_join: query = query.options(joinedload_all('instances')) result = query.first()
deleted_lines: def security_group_get(context, security_group_id, session=None): result = _security_group_get_query(context, session=session, project_only=True).\ filter_by(id=security_group_id).\ options(joinedload_all('instances')).\ first()

commit_message:
Use python-fixtures for image resource tracking in glance tests.

This patch switches the resource tracking of the glance api tests to
use fixtures. Instead of keeping a list of created images and then looping
over it at class teardown this patch switches to making a fixture for
each image.

Partially implements: blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Ib54835d2c2de16d30e72feffad366b0c6ace00c3

commit_message:
Document the OVS restart for the Ryu agent

When installing Quantum Ryu agent, the OVS service might not be properly
started due to a missing kernel module (compiled using DKMS). Make sure
that the OVS service is (re)started before restarting the Ryu agent
(completes commit 9489e66).

Change-Id: I659415bb7514cf5ac3619141e715351692c80854
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/30/34230/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: <para>Then restart the agent</para>

commit_message:
Compute Admin image guide refactor

Removed old content about creating custom images from the Compute
Admin Guide, added a pointer to the image guide.

Moved section about capturing images from running instances from
the Compute Admin Guide to the CLI guide.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/31911

commit_message:
The 'check_exists' applied to all API calls

* 404 is now returned instead of 500 in all API calls;
* direct calls to nova client moved from api/v10 to service/api
* utils/api has been updated to avoid implicit magic.

Partailly implements blueprint savanna-rest-api-1-0-validation

Change-Id: Id1e64b03920c59bc96da6c8f709bd1beccb59d76

commit_message:
Skip fixed_ip_details test with Quantum

Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
available in Quantum API must be skipped.

Fix Bug #1194569

Change-Id: If9b88c5b5883059d10116c72eeae17c22f6083cc

commit_message:

Quantum allows duplicate names for security groups,

commit_message:
Use os.path.join to form the cli command

 * If cli_dir path has no trailing "/" the generated command would no
 longer be malformed

 * Fix tempest.conf.sample: CLI group should not be capitalized

Change-Id: I4d367d4b6cde492ceb224c4b644d4853181a62ce

commit_message:
Skip list_vifs test with Quantum

Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
available in Quantum API must be skipped.

Fix Bug #1183436

Change-Id: I02ece3c49c9852197c7fb22c5025920baf60d98d

commit_message:
Import sql_connection option before using it.

This change fixes issues that would arise when testing certain files on
their own. Normal test runs were not affected due to serendipity in the
implied import order.

Change-Id: I9a85bf0112a9796482624e860efc2ec620aaf0f2

commit_message:
Deleted account respond as non existing accounts

Currently clients can not distinguish between non existing accounts
(which can be created) and accounts marked for deletion, which has
not yet been reaped and therefore cannot be re-created until reaped.

Following this patch, if an account is marked as deleted but hasn't
been reaped and is still on disk, responses will include a status
header:
    'X-Account-Status' = 'Deleted'

Fixes:Bug #1188609
Change-Id: Ibd39965ae3f5d45fd78f130e0e31f5a0141a8633

commit_message:
Re-use cache_url() in fedora element.

The fedora element downloads images too, so we should re-use the caching
code from the ubuntu element.

There doesn't seem to be other examples of code shared between root.d
scripts. In the fedora and dpkg elements we copy install-packages into
the chroot, but that model doesn't apply when we're running scripts
outside of the chroot. Seems sane to just run it directly from the bin/
dir in the temporary hooks directory.

Change-Id: Iaa6aca660042fea323cab4271633a4bdbbc271b8

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -e # Download a URL to a local cache # e.g. cache-url http://.../foo ~/.cache/image-create/foo url=$1 dest=$2 mkdir -p $(dirname $dest) tmp=$(mktemp $(dirname $dest)/.download.XXXXXXXX) if [ -f $dest ] ; then time_cond="-z $dest" success="Server copy has changed. Using server version of $url" else success="Downloaded and cached $url for the first time" fi rcode=$(curl -o $tmp -w '%{http_code}' $url $time_cond) if [ "$rcode" == "200" ] ; then echo $success mv $tmp $dest elif [ "$rcode" == "304" ] ; then echo "Server copy has not changed. Using locally cached $url" rm -f $tmp else echo "Server returned an unexpected response code. [$rcode]" rm -f $tmp exit 1 fi

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-24 11:33:01.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/common/rpc.py', 'glance/api/v1/upload_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/41cc89afa8ed7dda76eed5669ae1306a131bbbfc', 'message': 'Do not raise NEW exceptions

Raising NEW exception is bad practice, because we lose TraceBack.
So all places like:

except SomeException as e:
    raise e

should be replaced by

except SomeException:
    raise

If we are doing some other actions before reraising we should
store information about exception then do all actions and then
reraise it. This is caused by eventlet bug. It lost information
about exception if it switch threads.

fixes bug 1191730

Change-Id: I047e355607318bf9fa6208c2b174b7cc394297f0
'}]
commit_message:
Do not raise NEW exceptions

Raising NEW exception is bad practice, because we lose TraceBack.
So all places like:

except SomeException as e:
    raise e

should be replaced by

except SomeException:
    raise

If we are doing some other actions before reraising we should
store information about exception then do all actions and then
reraise it. This is caused by eventlet bug. It lost information
about exception if it switch threads.

fixes bug 1191730

Change-Id: I047e355607318bf9fa6208c2b174b7cc394297f0

commit_message:
Remove dependency on MySQL-python.

Tempest does not depend on MySQL, it depends on sqlalchemy. If the
cloud it's on was installed using MySQL, then MySQL will be instaled.
If it was installed using PostGres, then postgres will be instaled.
This dependency is misleading.

Change-Id: I9ad5fd3268fd35e20ec87a800123e522e34844c4

commit_message:
engine : stack_resource change state_description to status_reason

The internal API changed this name recently, but this got missed
due to lack of test coverage for this exception.  Turns out adding
that test coverage is really hard due to all the coroutine magic,
so we'll have to fix that at some later time.

Change-Id: I98a0c5bb8f3f001a7d215bcdf64cad841e42ef85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/30/34530/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.Error(self._nested.status_reason)
deleted_lines: raise exception.Error(self._nested.state_description)

commit_message:
Avoid jsonschema 1.4.0 - Release was pulled.

JSONSchema 1.4.0 appears to have been an accidental release of 2.0
code under the 1.4.0 version. It's been pulled from PyPi, but still
exists on the OpenStack mirror.

Discussion with the infra folks suggests updating the requirements
file rather than removing the release from the mirror is the best
solution.

Change-Id: I7619cc41c7924f2f02c8cf8d17034e58ac3b116c

commit_message:
Add network_utils.urlsplit

This unfortunately needed if we want to parse URL with params and
unknown schemes.

Change-Id: Ia7d8212370201254e537e6f1dd9b15d669a3252f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/34/33634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import urlparse def urlsplit(url, scheme='', allow_fragments=True): """Parse a URL using urlparse.urlsplit(), splitting query and fragments. That function papers over Python issue9374 when needed. :param url: The URL to split. """ parsed = urlparse.urlsplit(url, scheme, allow_fragments) if allow_fragments and '#' in parsed.path: parsed.path, parsed.fragment = parsed.path.split('#', 1) if '?' in parsed.path: parsed.path, parsed.query = parsed.path.split('?', 1) return parsed

commit_message:
Don't reconnect to exclusive fanout consumers.

See bug #1180166, basically we shouldn't be trying to reconnect to
exclusive queues.

Fixes: bug #1180166
Change-Id: I71ac5a150ea8c4d97a34404cb821ce8e8dfa152d

commit_message:
Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust

bug 1189711 Should RPC consume_in_thread() be more fault tolerant?

There are unprotected holes in the thread kicked off by RPC
consume_in_thread such that an exception will kill the thread.
This exists for both the service (TopicConsumer) and the new
reply proxy (DirectConsumer) consumers. This patch plugs
those holes as close to the base of the consumer thread as
possible by catching all non-caught exceptions and retrying
with sleeps between retries and some pacing of the log
output to prevent log flooding.

Change-Id: I0d6ec8a5e3a310314da201656ee862bb40b41616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/35/32235/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_service_consume_thread_handles_exceptions(self): def my_TopicConsumer_consume(myself, *args, **kwargs): self.consume_calls += 1 # see if it can sustain three failures if self.consume_calls < 3: raise Exception('unexpected exception') else: self.orig_TopicConsumer_consume(myself, *args, **kwargs) self.consume_calls = 0 self.orig_TopicConsumer_consume = impl_kombu.TopicConsumer.consume self.stubs.Set(impl_kombu.TopicConsumer, 'consume', my_TopicConsumer_consume) value = 42 result = self.rpc.call(FLAGS, self.context, self.topic, {"method": "echo", "args": {"value": value}}) self.assertEqual(value, result) self.stubs.UnsetAll() # TODO(pekowski): Enable this when single reply queue is enabled as default #def test_replyproxy_consume_thread_handles_exceptions(self): # def my_DirectConsumer_consume(myself, *args, **kwargs): # self.consume_calls += 1 # if self.consume_calls % 2: # self.orig_DirectConsumer_consume(myself, *args, **kwargs) # else: # raise Exception('unexpected exception') # self.consume_calls = 1 # self.orig_DirectConsumer_consume = impl_kombu.DirectConsumer.consume # self.stubs.Set(impl_kombu.DirectConsumer, 'consume', my_DirectConsumer_consume) # value = 42 # result = self.rpc.call(FLAGS, self.context, self.topic, # {"method": "echo", # "args": {"value": value}}) # self.assertEqual(value, result) # self.stubs.UnsetAll()

Session is not used for flow communications.

Plugin and hadoop_version parameters are passed through request parameters.
Helper method moved to util module.

commit_message:
Revert "Add oslo-config-1.2.0a2 and pbr>=0.5.16 to requirements."

This partially reverts commit:
   43b7f22b30244114f809e4c3b44dc337cade95f1.

The oslo.config change in that patch seems to break running unit
tests with tox. This reverts just that part of the change.

Change-Id: I977700d73342e81ee962019b76238d2cb2b1fff4

commit_message:
z/VM driver - Implement xCAT connection and get_host_stats

xCAT connection:
Provide zvm.utils.XCATUrl to generate xCAT uri. Implement
XCATConnection to send xCAT request via httpsconnection and do
some basic error check for the response data.

get_host_stats:
Get host information via xCAT host inventory function, and resolve
the infomation to OpenStack format.

Part 2 of blueprint zvm-plugin

Change-Id: I065072a003af91acbb0446a65375dccf9ffe96ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/31623/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import contextlib import functools import httplib import socket from nova.openstack.common import jsonutilsfrom nova.virt.zvm import const from nova.virt.zvm import exception def __init__(self): """Set constants that used to form xCAT url.""" self.SUFFIX = ''.join(('?userName=', CONF.zvm_xcat_username, '&password=', CONF.zvm_xcat_password, '&format=json')) self.NODES = '/nodes' self.POWER = '/power' self.INVENTORY = '/inventory' def rpower(self, arg=''): return ''.join((self.NODES, arg, self.POWER, self.SUFFIX)) def mkdef(self, arg=''): return ''.join((self.NODES, arg, self.SUFFIX)) def rinv(self, arg='', addp=None): rurl = ''.join((self.NODES, arg, self.INVENTORY, self.SUFFIX)) return self._append_addp(rurl, addp) def _append_addp(self, rurl, addp=None): if addp is not None: return ''.join((rurl, addp)) else: return rurl def __init__(self): self.host = CONF.zvm_xcat_server self.conn = httplib.HTTPSConnection(self.host) def request(self, method, url, body=None, headers={}): """Send request ot xCAT web service.""" url = ''.join(('/xcatws', url)) if body is not None: body = jsonutils.dumps(body) headers = {'content-type': 'text/plain', 'content-length': len(body)} try: self.conn.request(method, url, body, headers) except socket.gaierror as err: msg = _("Failed to find address %(host)s: %(reason)s") % { 'host': self.host, 'reason': err} raise exception.ZVMXCATRequestFailed(xcatserver=self.host, msg=msg) except (socket.error, socket.timeout) as err: msg = _("Communication with %(host)s error: %(reason)s") % { 'host': self.host, 'reason': err} raise exception.ZVMXCATRequestFailed(xcatserver=self.host, msg=msg) res = self.conn.getresponse() msg = res.read() resp = {'status': res.status, 'reason': res.reason, 'message': msg} # xCAT only return 200 and 201 as good status if (method == "POST" and res.status != 201) or ( method != "POST" and res.status != 200): err = str(resp) raise exception.ZVMXCATRequestFailed(xcatserver=self.host, msg=err) return resp def xcat_request(method, url, body=None, headers={}): """Send request to xCAT.""" conn = XCATConnection() resp = conn.request(method, url, body, headers) return _load_xcat_resp(resp['message']) @contextlib.contextmanager def expect_invalid_xcat_resp_data(): """Catch exceptions when using xCAT response data.""" try: yield except (ValueError, TypeError, IndexError, AttributeError, KeyError) as err: raise exception.ZVMInvalidXCATResponseDataError(msg=err) def wrap_invalid_xcat_resp_data_error(function): """Catch any exceptions when resolving xCAT response data.""" @functools.wraps(function) def decorated_function(*arg, **kwargs): try: return function(*arg, **kwargs) except (ValueError, TypeError, IndexError, AttributeError, KeyError) as err: raise exception.ZVMInvalidXCATResponseDataError(msg=err) return decorated_function @wrap_invalid_xcat_resp_data_error def _load_xcat_resp(message): """Load information from xCAT REST response body.""" resp_list = jsonutils.loads(message)['data'] keys = const.XCAT_RESPONSE_KEYS resp = {} for k in keys: resp[k] = [] for d in resp_list: for k in keys: if d.get(k) is not None: resp[k].append(d.get(k)) if resp.get('error'): raise exception.ZVMXCATInternalError(msg=message) else: return resp def convert_to_mb(s): """Convert memory format from 'gb' to 'mb'.""" s = s.upper() if s.endswith('G'): return float(s[:-1].strip()) * 1024 else: return float(s[:-1].strip()) @wrap_invalid_xcat_resp_data_error def resolve_xcat_resp(rawdata, dirt): """Resolve xCAT response to a dictionary with certain format.""" data_list = rawdata.split("\n") data = {} for ls in data_list: for k in dirt.keys(): if ls.__contains__(dirt[k]): data[k] = ls[(ls.find(dirt[k]) + len(dirt[k])):].strip() break if data == {}: msg = _("No value matched with keywords. Raw Data: %(raw)s; " "Keywords: %(kws)s") % {'raw': rawdata, 'kws': str(dirt)} raise exception.ZVMInvalidXCATResponseDataError(msg=msg) return data
deleted_lines: pass pass

commit_message:
Create a Collector which can store raw Events.

This introduces a new service called ceilometer-collector-event
which will grab notifications and store them in the Event and
Trait tables. The only driver currently implemented is for
AMQP via Kombu and librabbitmq.

This is different than the existing notification collector in that
it will only ack() the message when the event is successfully
persisted and it doesn't need to work around the oslo.rpc "method"/
"parameters" structure. It reads the notifications as they were sent.

More will need to be done to this to extract all the popular
traits from the events.

Change-Id: I9723134d6647ce2f7a90e2bc8633c6951bc9d8cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/92/32992/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceilometer.collector.events = event_driver = ceilometer.collector.event_driver:KombuDriver ceilometer-collector-event = ceilometer.collector.event_collector:event_collector

commit_message:
Create os-collect-config entry point.

Tool to grab config from known data sources. First data source is
The EC2 metadata service.

Change-Id: I33f8c1a96dc20486836055bb60d87f544aac2a62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-apply-config refs/changes/37/33137/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: os-collect-config = os_apply_config.collect:__main__

commit_message:
ZmqMsg class: Zero-copy and safe_log improvements

Introduces a ZmqMsg class to simplify decoding
zeromq-wire messages and our driver-specific envelope.

This also allows us to use zero-copy messaging throughout
the driver and introduces a "debug_log" method that
wraps rpc_common._safe_log.

ZmqProxy which previously added zero-copy support, but
in the process had to remove debug logging, now
has had debug logging restored.

Fixes bug 1171556

Change-Id: I929d365b53cc94e34aaf03b0b60dfe4ff2a4a881
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/47/31247/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import namedtuple import loggingclass ZmqMsgInvalid(Exception): pass RpcMsg = namedtuple('RpcMsg', ['ctx', 'msg']) class ZmqMsg(object): """Wrapper around raw ZeroMQ messages that understands our driver-specific envelope and automatically and intelligently copies data (otherwise allowing zero-copy) """ def __init__(self, data): stderr = _("ZMQ Envelope version unsupported or unknown.") try: self._topic = data[1] if data[2].bytes == 'impl_zmq_v2': self.version = 2 self.packenv = data[4:] self._ctx = zmsg[3] elif data[2].bytes == 'cast': # Legacy protocol self.version = 1 self.packenv = data[3] else: raise ZmqMsgInvalid(stderr) except IndexError: raise ZmqMsgInvalid(stderr) def message(self): if self.version == 2: envelope = unflatten_envelope(self.packenv.bytes) ctx = RpcContext.unmarshal(self._ctx.bytes) msg = rpc_common.deserialize_msg(envelope) elif self.version == 1: rctx, msg = _deserialize(self.packenv.bytes) ctx = RpcContext.unmarshal(rctx) return RpcMsg(ctx, msg) def safe_debug(self, msg): """Wrapper around safe_log that only copies data when debugging is enabled. """ if logging.getLogger().getEffectiveLevel() == logging.DEBUG: rpc_common._safe_log(LOG.debug, msg, self.message().msg) def topic(self): return self._topic.bytes data = sock.recv(copy=False) try: zmsg = ZmqMsg(data) except ZmqMsgInvalid as e: LOG.error(str(e)) return zmsg.safe_debug(_("Sending message: %s")) if sock in self.mapping: self.mapping[sock].send(data, copy=False) zmsg.safe_debug(_("Relayed out message: %s")) ctx, msg = zmsg.message() self.pool.spawn_n(self.process, proxy, ctx, msg) data = msg_waiter.recv(copy=False) try: zmsg = ZmqMsg(data) except ZmqMsgInvalid: raise RPCException(_("RPC Message Invalid.")) zmsg.safe_debug(_("Received message: %s")) responses = zmsg.message().msg['args']['response'] rpc_common._safe_log(LOG.debug, _("Sending message: %s"), msg)
deleted_lines: LOG.debug(_("Deserializing: %s"), data) LOG.debug(_("Running func with context: %s"), ctx.to_dict()) #TODO(ewindisch): use zero-copy (i.e. references, not copying) data = sock.recv() LOG.debug(_("CONSUMER RECEIVED DATA: %s"), data) if sock in self.mapping: LOG.debug(_("ROUTER RELAY-OUT %(data)s") % { 'data': data}) self.mapping[sock].send(data) if data[2] == 'cast': # Legacy protocol packenv = data[3] ctx, msg = _deserialize(packenv) request = rpc_common.deserialize_msg(msg) ctx = RpcContext.unmarshal(ctx) elif data[2] == 'impl_zmq_v2': packenv = data[4:] msg = unflatten_envelope(packenv) request = rpc_common.deserialize_msg(msg) # Unmarshal only after verifying the message. ctx = RpcContext.unmarshal(data[3]) else: LOG.error(_("ZMQ Envelope version unsupported or unknown.")) return self.pool.spawn_n(self.process, proxy, ctx, request) msg = msg_waiter.recv() LOG.debug(_("Received message: %s"), msg) LOG.debug(_("Unpacking response")) if msg[2] == 'cast': # Legacy version raw_msg = _deserialize(msg[-1])[-1] elif msg[2] == 'impl_zmq_v2': rpc_envelope = unflatten_envelope(msg[4:]) raw_msg = rpc_common.deserialize_msg(rpc_envelope) else: raise rpc_common.UnsupportedRpcEnvelopeVersion( _("Unsupported or unknown ZMQ envelope returned.")) responses = raw_msg['args']['response'] except (IndexError, KeyError): raise RPCException(_("RPC Message Invalid.")) LOG.debug(_("%(msg)s") % {'msg': ' '.join(map(pformat, (topic, msg)))})

commit_message:
Map internal S3 image state to EC2 API values

Fixes the EC2 API so it maps internal S3 image state values to
ones defined by the EC2 API rather than returning the internally
used values.

Fixes bug #1074904

Change-Id: Iabbda0e5fcbe4d572c76367c6f98d4bece050e73
(cherry picked from commit a977294b86287ebefba6eecb48d70166b1daf0f2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/28670/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # translate our internal state to states valid by the EC2 API documentation image_state_map = {'downloading': 'pending', 'failed_download': 'failed', 'decrypting': 'pending', 'failed_decrypt': 'failed', 'untarring': 'pending', 'failed_untar': 'failed', 'uploading': 'pending', 'failed_upload': 'failed', 'available': 'available'} try: image_copy['properties']['image_state'] = self.image_state_map[ image['properties']['image_state']] except (KeyError, ValueError): pass

commit_message:
Refactoring database backend checks

Generalized and combined individual database checks for mysql and postgres
into one _have_database function and passing backend.

Change-Id: Ia89360ed8f91a6ef5c9835512aa2a6b34d438196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/33193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _have_database(backend, user, passwd, database): if backend == "mysql": present = os.environ.get('NOVA_TEST_MYSQL_PRESENT') if present is None: return _is_backend_avail('mysql', user, passwd, database) elif backend == "postgres": present = os.environ.get('NOVA_TEST_POSTGRESQL_PRESENT') if present is None: return _is_backend_avail('postgres', user, passwd, database) if not _have_database("mysql", self.USER, self.PASSWD, self.DATABASE): if not _have_database("postgres", self.USER, self.PASSWD, self.DATABASE):
deleted_lines: def _have_mysql(user, passwd, database): present = os.environ.get('NOVA_TEST_MYSQL_PRESENT') if present is None: return _is_backend_avail('mysql', user, passwd, database) return present.lower() in ('', 'true') def _have_postgresql(user, passwd, database): present = os.environ.get('NOVA_TEST_POSTGRESQL_PRESENT') if present is None: return _is_backend_avail('postgres', user, passwd, database) if not _have_mysql(self.USER, self.PASSWD, self.DATABASE): if not _have_postgresql(self.USER, self.PASSWD, self.DATABASE):

commit_message:
The stop lpar method is not properly timing out

The self.run_vios_command(cmd) will not return immediately such that
the polling code in a certain timeout doesn't work as designed.
Let the self.run_vios_command(cmd) run by another thread by facilitating
the greengthread module in python.

Change-Id: I42a7004629d44d664c98b38e364ae52cd9fca864
Fixes: bug 1182002
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/30222/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp.from nova.openstack.common import processutilsfrom eventlet import greenthread except Exception as e: except processutils.ProcessExecutionError: """Deploy the logical volume and attach to new lpar. :param lpar: lar instance :param file_path: logical volume path :param size: new size of the logical volume """ need_decompress = file_path.endswith('.gz') self._deploy_from_vios_file(lpar, file_path, size, decompress=need_decompress) self._operator._remove_file(file_path) def _deploy_from_vios_file(self, lpar, file_path, size, decompress=True): self._disk_adapter._copy_file_to_device(file_path, diskName, decompress) # create a new connection or verify an existing connection # and re-establish if the existing connection is dead self._connection = common.check_connection(self._connection, self.connection_data) greenthread.spawn(self.run_vios_command, cmd) stdout, stderr = processutils.ssh_execute( self._connection, cmd, check_exit_code=check_exit_code) error_text = stderr.strip() if error_text: LOG.debug( _("Found error stream for command \"%(cmd)s\": %(error_text)s") % locals()) error_text = stderr.read() if error_text: LOG.debug( _("Found error stream for command \"%(command)s\":" " %(error_text)s") % locals())
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2012 IBM Corp.from nova import exception as nova_exceptionfrom nova import utils except Exception, e: except nova_exception.ProcessExecutionError: # decompress file gzip_ending = '.gz' if file_path.endswith(gzip_ending): raw_file_path = file_path[:-len(gzip_ending)] else: raw_file_path = file_path self._operator._decompress_image_file(file_path, raw_file_path) self._deploy_from_vios_file(lpar, raw_file_path, size) self._operator._remove_file(raw_file_path) def _deploy_from_vios_file(self, lpar, file_path, size): self._disk_adapter._copy_file_to_device(file_path, diskName) if self._connection is None: self._connection = common.ssh_connect(self.connection_data) self.run_vios_command(cmd) stdout, stderr = utils.ssh_execute(self._connection, cmd, check_exit_code=check_exit_code)

commit_message:
Workaround for Debian/Ubuntu precompression

Precompress / compile JS and CSS. Otherwise users must change
local_settings.py COMPRESS_OFFLINE to False

Change-Id: Id82b2ffc34c5643d2ae7a457cf35b2026acf53cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/45/32945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is a workaround for Debian/Ubuntu packages not precompressing # See README.compression in the package for more details if ($::osfamily == 'Debian') { package { 'node-less': require => Package['horizon'], ensure => 'installed', } file { '/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/templates': audit => mtime, recurse => true, notify => Exec['fix-compression-for-debian'], require => Package['node-less'], } exec { 'fix-compression-for-debian': cwd => "/usr/share/openstack-dashboard", path => "/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin", command => "python ./manage.py compress --force", refreshonly => true, }
deleted_lines: # I am totally confused by this, I do not think it should be installed... if ($::osfamily == 'Debian') { package { 'node-less': }

commit_message:
update fault['message'] to have more info

In many cases a fault's message will be set to the name
of the exception which caused the fault. This is not ideal
because it often hides the reason for the error from the user.
This information is available in the details section of the fault,
but that is not intended to be exposed to users.

This change sets the fault's message to the string representation
of the exception, which will include the message explaining why
the exception happened. If, for some reason, that message is empty
then the new code will still fall back to the exception class name
as before.

Fixes bug 1180618

Change-Id: I7ee6facbc309cf4113467f5b31443fd90a75d99c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/29333/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: message = fault.args[0] except Exception: pass
deleted_lines: message = fault.kwargs.get('value', message)

commit_message:
Add Midonet Plugin support

Midonet has a plugin in Quantum, and this is a first patch to support it from
Puppet Quantum Module.

Change-Id: Id81e5fd8be23b03153525a1de75a249921369d46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/75/32575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure the quantum server to use the Midonet plugin. # This configures the plugin for the API server, but does nothing # about configuring the agents that must also run and share a config # file with the Midonet plugin if both are on the same machine. class quantum::plugins::midonet ( $sql_connection = 'sqlite:////var/lib/quantum/midonet.sqlite', $midonet_uri = 'http://localhost:8080/midonet-api', $username = undef, $password = undef, $project_id = undef, $provider_router_id = undef, $metadata_router_id = undef, ) { include 'quantum::params' require 'vswitch::midonet' Quantum_plugin_midonet<||> ~> Service<| title == 'quantum-server' |> validate_re($sql_connection, '(sqlite|mysql|posgres):\/\/(\S+:\S+@\S+\/\S+)?') case $sql_connection { /mysql:\/\/\S+:\S+@\S+\/\S+/: { require 'mysql::python' } /postgresql:\/\/\S+:\S+@\S+\/\S+/: { $backend_package = 'python-psycopg2' } /sqlite:\/\//: { $backend_package = 'python-pysqlite2' } default: { fail('Unsupported backend configured') } } quantum_plugin_midonet { 'DATABASE/sql_connection': value => $sql_connection; 'MIDONET/midonet_uri': value => $midonet_uri; } if $::osfamily == 'Redhat' { file {'/etc/quantum/plugin.ini': ensure => link, target => '/etc/quantum/plugins/midonet/midonet.ini', require => Package['quantum-plugin-midonet'] } } }

commit_message:
Store created nova client in OpenStackClients.

All created clients are stored in the instance of OpenStackClients
which is associated with a stack - this prevents clients from
being repeatedly created throughout the request.

Commit f3fc5c5 introduced a regression which stopped storing the
nova client. This change addresses that regression.

Change-Id: I60088b60f623aac11e473d185f2924d4f4bd1cfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/60/34160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._nova[service_type] = client

commit_message:
Allow a resource delete to be re-attempted.

If a resource is in a DELETE IN_PROGRESS state, and the resource
is deleted again, another attempt will be made to delete the resource.

Fixes bug: #1193975

Change-Id: I615612b4e5f21f2a2cb168f47c33a8f9db7e9e81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/59/34159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if (self.action, self.status) == (self.DELETE, self.IN_PROGRESS): raise exception.Error('Resource deletion already in progress')

subject: Local write affinity for object PUT requests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-17 19:53:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9f01f063b75985c1345eaa6db231adf52264a3eb', 'message': 'Local write affinity for object PUT requests.

requests, where "local" is governed by the "write_affinity". The

I chose to simply re-order the object servers instead of filtering out
nonlocal ones so that, if all of the local ones are down, clients can

object servers across fast LAN links, clients get better throughput
than if the object servers were far away over slow WAN links. The
downside, of course, is that data availability (not durability) may
suffer when drives fail.

The default configuration has no write affinity in it, so the default
behavior is unchanged.

commit_message:
Local write affinity for object PUT requests.

The proxy can now be configured to prefer local object servers for PUT
requests, where "local" is governed by the "write_affinity". The
"write_affinity_node_count" setting controls how many local object
servers to try before giving up and going on to remote ones.

I chose to simply re-order the object servers instead of filtering out
nonlocal ones so that, if all of the local ones are down, clients can
still get successful responses (just slower).

The goal is to trade availability for throughput. By writing to local
object servers across fast LAN links, clients get better throughput
than if the object servers were far away over slow WAN links. The
downside, of course, is that data availability (not durability) may
suffer when drives fail.

The default configuration has no write affinity in it, so the default
behavior is unchanged.

Added some words about these settings to the admin guide.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I09a0bd00524544ff627a3bccdcdc48f40720a86e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/33/33333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import itertools def iter_nodes(self, ring, partition, node_iter=None): :param node_iter: optional iterable of nodes to try. Useful if you want to filter or reorder the nodes. if node_iter is None: node_iter = itertools.chain(ring.get_part_nodes(partition), ring.get_more_nodes(partition)) num_primary_nodes = len(ring.get_part_nodes(partition)) # Use of list() here forcibly yanks the first N nodes (the primary # nodes) from node_iter, so the rest of its values are handoffs. primary_nodes = self.app.sort_nodes( list(itertools.islice(node_iter, num_primary_nodes))) handoff_nodes = node_iter for node in handoff_nodes: query_string='', node_iter=None): :param node_iter: optional iterator for ring nodes if node_iter is None: nodes = GreenthreadSafeIterator(self.iter_nodes(ring, part)) else: nodes = GreenthreadSafeIterator(node_iter)
deleted_lines: def iter_nodes(self, ring, partition): primary_nodes = self.app.sort_nodes(ring.get_part_nodes(partition)) for node in ring.get_more_nodes(partition): query_string=''): nodes = GreenthreadSafeIterator(self.iter_nodes(ring, part))

commit_message:
Update kombu requirement

The minimum version of kombu in the requirements
list has been updated to ensure that compatible
kombu and msgpack libraries are used across all
projects. This update also requires a bump for
anyjson.

Addresses bug #1134575

Change-Id: Ic33a5bbc8d1cdf1effd41c1c2aebc7ef6988c39e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/17/33717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix pyOpenSSL on Fedora.

On fedora 18 the package pyOpenSSL is conflicting with one of the
packages needed to build the bootstack image. The problem gets sorted
if you install pyOpenSSL at the beginning of the image building process
and this is what this patch is doing.

Change-Id: I681683b81ad638dfeb690fde1bc7d08a2116aaed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/95/33795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # FIXME: On fedora 18 the package pyOpenSSL is conflicting with one of the # packages needed to build the bootstack image. The problem gets sorted # if you install pyOpenSSL at the beginning of the image building process. # We need to do some more investigation here. # http://paste.openstack.org/show/39016/ install-packages python-pyopenssl

commit_message:
Open keystone service port on Fedora.

This port allow keystone admin without logging in the bootstrap node. The
patch also rename the script making it run before the 98-boot-stack,
the 98-boot-stack will add some rules to the firewall that shouldn't be
saved in the /etc/sysconfig/iptables.

Change-Id: I2497e3ce7b20761bbc29f71f778ba349f6c21b09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/83/34183/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 35357 -j ACCEPT

added_lines: function create_base () { mkdir $TMP_BUILD_DIR/mnt export TMP_MOUNT_PATH=$TMP_BUILD_DIR/mnt # Copy data in to the root. TARGET_ROOT=$TMP_MOUNT_PATH run_d root if [ -z "$(ls $TMP_MOUNT_PATH | grep -v lost+found)" ] ; then # Nothing copied in, use Ubuntu. echo "Adding ubuntu element as / had no contents" IMAGE_ELEMENT=$($SCRIPT_HOME/element-info --expand-dependencies $IMAGE_ELEMENT ubuntu) generate_hooks echo "Now building: $IMAGE_ELEMENT" TARGET_ROOT=$TMP_MOUNT_PATH run_d root fi # Configure Image # Setup resolv.conf so we can chroot to install some packages if [ -L $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf ] || [ -f $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf ] ; then sudo mv $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf.ORIG fi # Recreate resolv.conf sudo touch $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf sudo chmod 777 $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf # use system configured resolv.conf if available to support internal proxy resolving if [ -e /etc/resolv.conf ] then cat /etc/resolv.conf > $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf else echo nameserver 8.8.8.8 > $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/etc/resolv.conf fi mount_proc_dev_sys } function mount_proc_dev_sys () { # supporting kernel file systems sudo mount -t proc none $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/proc sudo mount --bind /dev $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/dev sudo mount -t sysfs none $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/sys }

commit_message:
Tweak seed element NAT rules.

To be able to route traffic to the bootstack control plane, we need to
not mangle it when the traffic is from te kvm host. Libvirt uses
192.168.122.1 as the host IP.

Change-Id: I6ca107ddab2b7d5c3a8ca1233f2f9f2ead11db74

commit_message:
Set a fixed host for nova in boot-stack.

This makes the registration scripts be able to depend on the hostname,
irrespective of the static hostname in the base image used for seed
nodes.

Change-Id: I6bc1c2560d2d548ab99cb6f4129c70e572a918dc

commit_message:
correctly set iface-id in vmware driver

bug 1183452

Commit 70c659059b8fbef811ce79700aecb01c60242ebd updated the vmware
driver to use the new vif model, but was incorrect in how it tried to
grab the iface-id and set it in the vmx file spec.  This patch fixes
that issue and adds a check for this in the existing unit tests.

Change-Id: I756539871d1844a828f9a0a295fc9fa3e59610f7
(cherry picked from commit c028e54f6be75d1cd335550cf5291ddf94f973e3)

commit_message:
port agent API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ib7c489769d9b07797366be5920cc23ab2074a768

commit_message:
Adds v3 API extension discovery filtering

Adds ability for a v3 loaded extension to be visible in
/v3/extensions to be dependent on the discoverable action policy
for that extension. Note that this does not actually effect whether
or not the functionality provided by the extension is accessible

Implements blueprint nova-v3-api-filter

Change-Id: I3f6ba7ea59e7abfa9d57b79ab18aa5b675e64118

commit_message:
Adds link to block storage page from config and admin scheduler pages. Also fixes missed update to admin scheduler page from bug-1192627,

modified link text as per anne https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34048/

updated URL text to reflect latest cinder doc title

bug-1193432

not) independently.

commit_message:
Refactor and partly parallelise stack update code

Make this easier to read, and also use co-routines to make it run in
parallel where possible.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-18 10:45:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/d1434e43ac3119f132eda74966e487a3ba61bd36', 'message': 'Add IpFilter and IPNetnsExecFilter

IpFilter provides support for filtering ip commands
IpNetnsExecFilter is a chaining command filter that
verifies that the command to be executed by ip netns exec
is covered by other established filters.

Implements bp rootwrap-quantum-features

Change-Id: I0cf39967126e99a8dc53d21bee824a0fe2f63aa0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-18 11:51:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/4e136084437ddf71cc47a3e41df9029c42a64660', 'message': 'Add IpFilter, IPNetnsExecFilter and DnsmasqNetnsFilter

These filters have been implemented in Quantum before:

- IpFilter provides support for filtering ip commands
- IpNetnsExecFilter is a chaining command filter that
  verifies that the command to be executed by ip netns exec
  is covered by other established filters.
- DnsmasqNetnsFilter is a filter that combines both
  DnsmasqFilter and IpNetnsExecFilter

Implements bp rootwrap-quantum-features

Change-Id: I0cf39967126e99a8dc53d21bee824a0fe2f63aa0
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-01 10:24:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/57ee3040f861edd7da8281de4e5ee2ca30731c97', 'message': 'Add IpFilter, IPNetnsExecFilter and EnvFilter

These filters have been implemented in Quantum before:

- IpFilter provides support for filtering ip commands
- IpNetnsExecFilter is a chaining command filter that
  verifies that the command to be executed by ip netns exec
  is covered by other established filters.

EnvFilter is a new chaining command filter that allows
to freely combine "env A=X B=Y" with other CommandFilters.
This is intended to replace the specific DnsmasqFilter
and DnsmasqNetnsFilter in Quantum.

Implements bp rootwrap-quantum-features

Change-Id: I0cf39967126e99a8dc53d21bee824a0fe2f63aa0
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-06-08 13:05:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/395236d2315b9fd454b737c1368dde238ce19d13', 'message': 'Add IpFilter, IPNetnsExecFilter and EnvFilter

These filters have been implemented in Quantum before:

- IpFilter provides support for filtering ip commands
- IpNetnsExecFilter is a chaining command filter that
  verifies that the command to be executed by ip netns exec
  is covered by other established filters.

IpNetnsExecFilter has been restricted to ensure that the
filter chains have all matching filters run as the same
user.

EnvFilter is a new filter derived from CommandFilter
that allows a Command to be prefixed by "env" and a specific
list of environment variables.

This is intended to replace the specific DnsmasqFilter
and DnsmasqNetnsFilter in the future when all consumers
have been updated.

Implements bp rootwrap-quantum-features

Change-Id: I0cf39967126e99a8dc53d21bee824a0fe2f63aa0

commit_message:
Add IpFilter, IPNetnsExecFilter and EnvFilter

These filters have been implemented in Quantum before:

- IpFilter provides support for filtering ip commands
- IpNetnsExecFilter is a chaining command filter that
  verifies that the command to be executed by ip netns exec
  is covered by other established filters.

IpNetnsExecFilter has been restricted to ensure that the
filter chains have all matching filters run as the same
user.

EnvFilter is a new filter derived from CommandFilter
that allows a Command to be optionally prefixed by "env"
and a specific list of environment variables.

This is intended to replace the specific DnsmasqFilter
and DnsmasqNetnsFilter in the future when all consumers
have been updated.

Implements bp rootwrap-quantum-features

Change-Id: I0cf39967126e99a8dc53d21bee824a0fe2f63aa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/36/29636/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance(f, filters.ChainingFilter): # This command calls exec verify that remaining args # matches another filter. leaf_filters = [fltr for fltr in filter_list if not isinstance(fltr, filters.ChainingFilter)] args = f.exec_args(userargs) if (not args or not match_filter(leaf_filters, args, exec_dirs=exec_dirs)): continue

commit_message:
Enable uncompress two or more files to same directory

pass metadata_pairs_hook to json.loads, when duplicated keys found in
pairs, return pairs directly, or convert pairs list to dict.

Change-Id: Id82d701eea166361d71a284f8bf446b39bf23915
Fixes: bug #1190875

commit_message:
Allow JSON values for parameters

Adds a paramter type that accepts JSON objects or strings representing JSON
objects as values.

Implements: blueprint json-parameters
Change-Id: I1ad62df28832a2e07249452133fd9f14995f8e23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/72/33572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json STRING, NUMBER, COMMA_DELIMITED_LIST, JSON 'String', 'Number', 'CommaDelimitedList', 'Json' elif param_type == JSON: ParamClass = JsonParam value.split(',') except AttributeError: message = 'Value must be a comma-delimited list string' raise ValueError(self._error_msg(message))class JsonParam(Parameter, collections.Mapping): """A template parameter who's value is valid map.""" parsed = None def _validate(self, value): if isinstance(value, collections.Mapping): self.parsed = value self.user_value = json.dumps(value) else: try: self.parsed = json.loads(value) except ValueError: message = 'Value "%s" must be a valid map' % value raise ValueError(self._error_msg(message)) # check length my_len = len(self.parsed) if MAX_LENGTH in self.schema: max_length = int(self.schema[MAX_LENGTH]) if my_len > max_length: message = ('map value length (%d) overflows %s %s' % (my_len, MAX_LENGTH, max_length)) raise ValueError(self._error_msg(message)) if MIN_LENGTH in self.schema: min_length = int(self.schema[MIN_LENGTH]) if my_len < min_length: message = ('value length (%d) underflows %s %s' % (my_len, MIN_LENGTH, min_length)) raise ValueError(self._error_msg(message)) # check valid keys if VALUES in self.schema: allowed = self.schema[VALUES] bad_keys = [k for k in self.parsed if k not in allowed] if bad_keys: message = ('keys %s are not in %s %s' % (bad_keys, VALUES, allowed)) raise ValueError(self._error_msg(message)) def __getitem__(self, key): return self.parsed[key] def __iter__(self): return iter(self.parsed) def __len__(self): return len(self.parsed)
deleted_lines: STRING, NUMBER, COMMA_DELIMITED_LIST 'String', 'Number', 'CommaDelimitedList' sp = value.split(',') except AttributeError: raise ValueError('Value must be a comma-delimited list string')

commit_message:
Fix the current flake8 errors

The test pip ordering was resulting in the pep8 rules not really
running so this fixes that up and the resulting errors so we can
get a clean run.

Change-Id: Icc27be05cd513c4f04135c7e768007dbf9d07b10

commit_message:
Make InstanceList filter non-column extra attributes

This is a no-op right now, but we need to avoid passing things
like fault to the instance_get_all() queries. This will be used
in changes to follow.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I66355a024b139fa6c579e04885ba52f9697381fe

commit_message:
Add Instance.security_groups

This makes Instance load the security_groups list when it
is present in the database object.

It also refactors the way info_cache is saved, so that it
can more easily apply to security_groups as well.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model
Fixes bug 1192003

Change-Id: Ifb028e17ffef7c14557e6389a650d66ce8e9b25c

deleted_lines: setattr(instance, k, v) 'network_info': None})

commit_message:
Add basic SecurityGroup model

This adds a basic SecurityGroup model and query methods.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I92a18529add3e46e801a30e35cdbd4932c890a55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/33494/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import db from nova.objects import base class SecurityGroup(base.NovaObject): fields = { 'id': int, 'name': str, 'description': str, 'user_id': str, 'project_id': str, } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(secgroup, db_secgroup): # NOTE(danms): These are identical right now for field in secgroup.fields: secgroup[field] = db_secgroup[field] secgroup.obj_reset_changes() return secgroup @base.remotable_classmethod def get(cls, context, secgroup_id): db_secgroup = db.security_group_get(context, secgroup_id) return cls._from_db_object(cls(), db_secgroup) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_name(cls, context, project_id, group_name): db_secgroup = db.security_group_get_by_name(context, project_id, group_name) return cls._from_db_object(cls(), db_secgroup) @base.remotable def in_use(self, context): return db.security_group_in_use(context, self.id) @base.remotable def save(self, context): updates = {} for field in self.obj_what_changed(): updates[field] = self[field] if updates: db_secgroup = db.security_group_update(context, self.id, updates) SecurityGroup._from_db_object(self, db_secgroup) self.obj_reset_changes() @base.remotable def refresh(self, context): SecurityGroup._from_db_object(self, db.security_group_get(context, self.id)) def _make_secgroup_list(context, secgroup_list, db_secgroup_list): secgroup_list.objects = [] for db_secgroup in db_secgroup_list: secgroup = SecurityGroup._from_db_object(SecurityGroup(), db_secgroup) secgroup._context = context secgroup_list.objects.append(secgroup) secgroup_list.obj_reset_changes() return secgroup_list class SecurityGroupList(base.ObjectListBase, base.NovaObject): @base.remotable_classmethod def get_all(cls, context): return _make_secgroup_list(context, cls(), db.security_group_get_all(context)) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_project(cls, context, project_id): return _make_secgroup_list(context, cls(), db.security_group_get_by_project( context, project_id)) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_instance(cls, context, instance): return _make_secgroup_list(context, cls(), db.security_group_get_by_instance( context, instance.uuid))

subject: Refresh volume connections when starting instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-06 16:18:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/686d2b5096d98b777e89e5e77843841dde500524', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections

This patch is a quick prototype of an approach to re-establishing
mounted volume attachments when starting instances. It adds
a specialized method to the virtualization driver to perform
the operations required to make the prepare the system so that
the virtualization technology can properly re-establish mounts
when the respective instance is started.

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-06 18:04:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4f3160312d8fb1458a4fd6fe9ce67908adaf2b8c', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections

This patch is a quick prototype of an approach to re-establishing
mounted volume attachments when starting instances. It adds
a specialized method to the virtualization driver to perform
the operations required to make the prepare the system so that
the virtualization technology can properly re-establish mounts
when the respective instance is started.

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-06 18:47:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5a1bb247dfe3c397c60a0c6381b9f107f94bb61b', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections

This patch is a quick prototype of an approach to re-establishing
mounted volume attachments when starting instances. It adds
a specialized method to the virtualization driver to perform
the operations required to make the prepare the system so that
the virtualization technology can properly re-establish mounts
when the respective instance is started.

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-06-06 19:36:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0e0925c8e6e6c746fd504e36c70b61030c92ef46', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patch adds a method for re-establishing configurations for attached
volumes when an instance is started or rebooted. A new method is
added to the virtualization driver interface for reconnecting volumes.
On instance startup, the stored block device mappings are iterated and
the reconnect method invoked for each one. NotImplemented exceptions
are caught as, for the time being, only the libvirt implementation is
available. When the reconnect method is called, the virtualization
driver implementation should perform whatever operations are necessary
(e.g. mount a filesystem, instantiate an iSCSI session) for the
instance to successfully start.

Fixes bug: 1188326

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2013-06-19 00:01:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/52e6f4fc22c82d871b39711e0c866ca88ff77583', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patch adds a method for re-establishing configurations for attached
volumes when an instance is started or rebooted. A new method is
added to the virtualization driver interface for reconnecting volumes.
On instance startup, the stored block device mappings are iterated and
the reconnect method invoked for each one. NotImplemented exceptions
are caught as, for the time being, only the libvirt implementation is
available. When the reconnect method is called, the virtualization
driver implementation should perform whatever operations are necessary
(e.g. mount a filesystem, instantiate an iSCSI session) for the
instance to successfully start.

Fixes bug: 1188326

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2013-06-19 16:41:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f725482386ab02d58ac1434e200972e1c3a5e87a', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patch adds a method for re-establishing configurations for attached
volumes when an instance is started or rebooted. A new method is
added to the virtualization driver interface for reconnecting volumes.
On instance startup, the stored block device mappings are iterated and
the reconnect method invoked for each one. NotImplemented exceptions
are caught as, for the time being, only the libvirt implementation is
available. When the reconnect method is called, the virtualization
driver implementation should perform whatever operations are necessary
(e.g. mount a filesystem, instantiate an iSCSI session) for the
instance to successfully start.

Fixes bug: 1188326

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153

commit_message:
Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patches adds network and block device information to the signature
of the power_on method on the virtualization driver. The relevant call
sites are also modified to provide the required information. The libvirt
implementation of power_on has been altered to re-establish network and
volume related connections.

Fixes bug: 1188326

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153

commit_message:
api: enable v2 tests on SQLAlchemy & HBase

And there's a lot of tests no passing that I let commanted to someone
can jump in and try to fix these drivers.

Change-Id: Ic81d69735f5c7b227f62ff566e43552fa03ffc50

commit_message:
Port quota API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I29bb4dd7d1a8acaa3e91e5f0ec5c073d3d9756fc

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2011 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import webob from nova.api.openstack import extensions from nova.api.openstack import wsgi from nova.api.openstack import xmlutil import nova.context from nova import db from nova import exception from nova.openstack.common import log as logging from nova import quota QUOTAS = quota.QUOTAS LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) authorize_update = extensions.extension_authorizer('compute', 'quotas:update') authorize_show = extensions.extension_authorizer('compute', 'quotas:show') authorize_delete = extensions.extension_authorizer('compute', 'quotas:delete') class QuotaTemplate(xmlutil.TemplateBuilder): def construct(self): root = xmlutil.TemplateElement('quota_set', selector='quota_set') root.set('id') for resource in QUOTAS.resources: elem = xmlutil.SubTemplateElement(root, resource) elem.text = resource return xmlutil.MasterTemplate(root, 1) class QuotaSetsController(object): def __init__(self, ext_mgr): self.ext_mgr = ext_mgr def _format_quota_set(self, project_id, quota_set): """Convert the quota object to a result dict.""" result = dict(id=str(project_id)) for resource in QUOTAS.resources: result[resource] = quota_set[resource] return dict(quota_set=result) def _validate_quota_limit(self, limit): # NOTE: -1 is a flag value for unlimited if limit < -1: msg = _("Quota limit must be -1 or greater.") raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) def _get_quotas(self, context, id, usages=False): values = QUOTAS.get_project_quotas(context, id, usages=usages) if usages: return values else: return dict((k, v['limit']) for k, v in values.items()) @wsgi.serializers(xml=QuotaTemplate) def show(self, req, id): context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize_show(context) try: nova.context.authorize_project_context(context, id) return self._format_quota_set(id, self._get_quotas(context, id)) except exception.NotAuthorized: raise webob.exc.HTTPForbidden() @wsgi.serializers(xml=QuotaTemplate) def update(self, req, id, body): context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize_update(context) project_id = id bad_keys = [] for key in body['quota_set'].keys(): if (key not in QUOTAS and key != 'tenant_id' and key != 'id'): bad_keys.append(key) if len(bad_keys) > 0: msg = _("Bad key(s) %s in quota_set") % ",".join(bad_keys) raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) for key in body['quota_set'].keys(): try: value = int(body['quota_set'][key]) except (ValueError, TypeError): LOG.warn(_("Quota for %s should be integer.") % key) # NOTE(hzzhoushaoyu): Do not prevent valid value to be # updated. If raise BadRequest, some may be updated and # others may be not. continue self._validate_quota_limit(value) try: db.quota_update(context, project_id, key, value) except exception.ProjectQuotaNotFound: db.quota_create(context, project_id, key, value) except exception.AdminRequired: raise webob.exc.HTTPForbidden() return {'quota_set': self._get_quotas(context, id)} @wsgi.serializers(xml=QuotaTemplate) def defaults(self, req, id): context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize_show(context) return self._format_quota_set(id, QUOTAS.get_defaults(context)) def delete(self, req, id): if self.ext_mgr.is_loaded('os-extended-quotas'): context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize_delete(context) try: nova.context.authorize_project_context(context, id) QUOTAS.destroy_all_by_project(context, id) return webob.Response(status_int=202) except exception.NotAuthorized: raise webob.exc.HTTPForbidden() raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound() class Quotas(extensions.ExtensionDescriptor): """Quotas management support.""" name = "Quotas" alias = "os-quota-sets" namespace = "http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/quotas-sets/api/v1.1" updated = "2011-08-08T00:00:00+00:00" def get_resources(self): resources = [] res = extensions.ResourceExtension('os-quota-sets', QuotaSetsController(self.ext_mgr), member_actions={'defaults': 'GET'}) resources.append(res) return resources

commit_message:
Add new optional "data_iter" argument to SwiftBackupService.backup

Introduce new optional data_iter argument to SwiftBackupService.backup
which allows drivers to forward stream iterators to the backup services

commit_message:
Implement backup_volume for RBDDriver over Swift

Allow backing up of Ceph images over Swift. Instead of mapping or
exporting a ceph Image to a path and calling the backup from the
BackendService, a stream is created and backed up instead (no need to
dump the volume to a local temp path).

Change-Id: I27fa25a93cec70ee7b5b9c7b6b2b919803b91a46

commit_message:
Use os.path.join with cli_dir

Use os.path.join to create final cli path.  This allows the path to be
specified in the same way as the extant "bin_dir" provided to the
whitebox tests; this is useful to a top-level driver like devstack so
it doesn't have to worry about differences with trailing /'s

TODO: create one global config for both?

Change-Id: Ied5a62993fa9a62fd06cc0341888c5cbc62c8a91

commit_message:
Improve implementation of RBDDriver.backup_volume

Instead of mapping or exporting the the volume, it is wrapped in
a new class that implements the read and tell functionalities of a
file. This allows us to stream the content from the rbd volume
directly (better performance and less disk usage)

Change-Id: I8d59f2ad6ffdb8085584a5d07f517dfaf60fca8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/15/34415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class _RBDVolumeFileWrapper(object): def __init__(self, volume_id, rbd_pool): self._cluster = rados.Rados(conffile=cfg.CONF.backup_ceph_conf) self._cluster.connect() self._ioctx = self._cluster.open_ioctx(rbd_pool) self._image = rbd.Image(self._ioctx, str("volume-%s" % volume_id)) self._offset = 0 def __del__(self): self._cluster.close() self._ioctx.close() self._image.close() def tell(self): return self._offset def read(self, block_size_bytes): data = self._image.read(self._offset, block_size_bytes) self._offset += block_size_bytes return data rbd_file = _RBDVolumeFileWrapper(volume.id, self.configuration.rbd_pool) try: backup_service.backup(backup, rbd_file) finally: del rbd_file
deleted_lines: tmp_path = self._get_tmp_path(volume['id'], backup['id']) # Make sure the file does not exist otherwise the export will fail os.path.exists(tmp_path) and os.unlink(tmp_path) with fileutils.remove_path_on_error(tmp_path): args = ['rbd', 'export', '--pool', self.configuration.rbd_pool, volume['name'], tmp_path] args += self._ceph_args() self._try_execute(*args) try: with fileutils.remove_path_on_error(os.path.basename(tmp_path)): with utils.temporary_chown(os.path.dirname(tmp_path)): with fileutils.file_open(tmp_path) as tmp_file: backup_service.backup(backup, tmp_file) finally: # Always delete the tmp file os.unlink(tmp_path)

commit_message:
Return Customer's Quota Usage through Admin API

Modified the used limits API for Admin to retrieve
the used limits for a customer. Changes done to the
nova client to fetch limits for a given tenant.

This is related to changes made in nova,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27468/

Change-Id: Id53576eb35d6dab7cb655f8427091e95a6f75a6d
Implements: blueprint customer-quota-through-admin-api

commit_message:
Enable pxe_network_config option.

This option tells the nova baremetal driver to append the network
configuration to the kernel cmdline when pxe booting the baremetal
image. Initramfs built with network support could then benefit from
this option and avoid the need of having the network configuration file
injected into the image.

commit_message:
Fix cloud-init routing issue on Fedora

Add "NONZEROCONF=yes" to /etc/sysconfig/network to prevent
169.254.0.0 route from being created. This route interferes
with fedora baremetal nodes' access to the nova metadata
server at 169.254.169.254.

Change-Id: Iad77abfc97c0eba944680772f233389481a270ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/72/34472/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh # zeroconf should not be activated or it will add a 169.254.0.0 # route. The route will interfere with access to the nova metadata # server at 169.254.169.254. if ! grep NOZEROCONF /etc/sysconfig/network ; then echo "NOZEROCONF=yes" >> /etc/sysconfig/network fi
